The four qualities of a great man with g: Very learned in diverse fields of learning
Understand the meaning of diverse statements
Mindful and able to remember and recollect what was said and done long ago
Deft and tireless in household duties, understanding how to go about things in order to complete and organize the work
Practices for the welfare and happiness of the people
Established many people in the noble method, that is, the principles of goodness and skillfulness
Gets the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when they want, without trouble or difficulty
Realizes the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
The qualities of the Buddha [an4.35:7.4]: Practices for the welfare and happiness of the people
Achieved mental mastery of the paths of thought
Gets the four absorptions—blissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind—when he wants, without trouble or difficulty
Realized the undefiled freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom in this very life
Discovered release from the snare of death for all beings
Explained the method of the teaching for the welfare of gods and humans
Skilled in the variety of paths
Completed the task and is free of defilements
